abstract: The Cardinals and the Texas Rangers ride thunderous offenses into the 107th World Series, which starts Wednesday at Busch Stadium in St. Louis.
snippet: The Cardinals and the Texas Rangers ride thunderous offenses into the 107th World Series, which starts Wednesday at Busch Stadium in St. Louis.
lead_paragraph: ST. LOUIS - In the 1932 World Series, when the Yankees swept the Chicago Cubs, the teams combined to average 14 runs per game. All these years later, withstanding strong challenges from the designated hitter and the steroids era, those 14 runs per game remain a World Series record.

headline.main: Offenses Point to High-Scoring World Series
